discoveredAssets: localhost - Art Gallery Web Application - Python/Django (WSGIServer/0.2 CPython/3.9.2) - Port 80
localhost / - Main homepage with art gallery grid display (200 OK) - 9 art items for sale
localhost /accounts/login/ - User login endpoint (200 OK) - Email and password fields, CSRF protected
localhost /accounts/logout/ - User logout endpoint (302 redirect to /) - CSRF protected
localhost /accounts/register/step1/ - Multi-step registration step 1 (200 OK) - Name and password fields (min 10 chars), CSRF protected
localhost /accounts/register/step2/ - Multi-step registration step 2 (requires step 1) - CSRF protected
localhost /static/ - Static file serving (Bootstrap 4, jQuery 3.5.1, Popper.js, images)
Django Debug Mode (DEBUG = True) - Exposes URL patterns, project structure, and full stack traces in error pages - Project named 'ssti_debug_art_gallery' indicates intentional SSTI vulnerabilities
Application Security Controls - CSRF protection on all forms, X-Frame-Options: DENY, X-Content-Type-Options: nosniff, SameSite=Lax on cookies

targets.objective: Test for Server-Side Template Injection (SSTI) vulnerabilities in application (project name indicates SSTI is present). Test gallery display, search functionality, and any user input processing for template injection. Test for injection in search parameters (?q=), form inputs, and URL parameters.
targets.rationale: Project is named 'ssti_debug_art_gallery' indicating SSTI vulnerabilities are intentionally present for testing. This is the main application entry point and should be tested for injection attacks, particularly SSTI which is indicated by the project name.

targets.objective: Test registration form for injection vulnerabilities (SQLi, NoSQLi, SSTI), input validation bypass, password strength enforcement bypass, account enumeration, and race conditions. Test POST method with various payloads. Verify minimum password length enforcement. Test for timing-based enumeration.
targets.rationale: User registration is a critical authentication endpoint. Step 1 accepts 'name' and 'password' fields. Test for injection vulnerabilities, particularly SSTI given project context. Verify input validation and password policies are enforced correctly.

targets.objective: Test registration step 2 for injection vulnerabilities, session management flaws, and bypass of step 1 requirements. Attempt direct access and test POST method. Verify proper state validation between steps.
targets.rationale: Multi-step registration forms often have state management issues. Step 2 requires completion of Step 1 but security controls should be verified. Test for authorization bypass and CSRF vulnerabilities.

targets.objective: Test login endpoint for authentication bypass (SQLi, NoSQLi, credential stuffing), brute force protection, timing attacks, and CSRF. Test both username and password fields. Verify account lockout mechanisms. Test for LDAP injection, SAML injection, and other auth bypass techniques.
targets.rationale: Login is a critical security-sensitive endpoint. Test authentication logic for injection vulnerabilities (especially SSTI), enumeration attacks, and brute force resistance. Verify proper error messages do not leak user information.

targets.objective: Test logout endpoint for session management issues, CSRF protection, and post-logout page security. Verify sessions are properly invalidated. Test for open redirect vulnerabilities.
targets.rationale: Logout endpoints often have CSRF issues or redirect vulnerabilities. Verify session invalidation is complete and secure.

targets.objective: Test GET / endpoint with various query parameters (?q=<value>) for injection vulnerabilities including SQLi, NoSQLi, SSTI, XSS, and command injection. Test with template syntax payloads given SSTI project context. Test with large inputs, special characters, and Unicode.
targets.rationale: Query parameters in the main page should be tested for injection vulnerabilities. The project name indicates SSTI testing should be prioritized. The search field may process input without proper sanitization.

targets.objective: Test static file serving for directory traversal, path traversal, and access control. Verify static files cannot be used to access sensitive files. Test for XXE in image uploads if enabled. Check for information disclosure through file serving.
targets.rationale: Static file serving at /static/ directory should be verified for access control and path traversal vulnerabilities. Ensure directory listing is disabled and only intended files are accessible.

targets.objective: Test CSRF token validation, cookie security (SameSite policy), session fixation, and cross-origin request handling. Verify CSRF tokens are properly rotated. Test for authenticated bypasses in account endpoints.
targets.rationale: Account management endpoints should be tested for CSRF vulnerabilities despite protection headers. SameSite=Lax allows some cross-site requests that should be evaluated. Test for session-based attacks and cookie manipulation.

targets.target: http://localhost/ - Django Debug Mode Information Disclosure
targets.objective: Test for information disclosure via Django debug error pages. Enumerate URL patterns from 404 pages. Collect sensitive information about project structure and configuration. Test for debug endpoint access.
targets.rationale: DEBUG = True is enabled, exposing URL patterns, project structure, and exception details. This is a critical security issue but valuable for reconnaissance. Error pages reveal URLconf location and implementation details.

keyFindings: [CRITICAL] Django DEBUG = True is enabled in production - Full stack traces, URL patterns, and project structure are exposed to all users via error pages. Project name 'ssti_debug_art_gallery' reveals intentional SSTI vulnerabilities present.

[CRITICAL] Project explicitly designed with SSTI (Server-Side Template Injection) vulnerabilities - Name 'ssti_debug_art_gallery' indicates SSTI testing is the primary purpose. All user input should be tested for template injection.

[HIGH] Multi-step user registration flow at /accounts/register/ with no obvious step validation - Step 2 redirects back to Step 1 if incomplete, suggesting state validation exists but should be tested for bypass.

[HIGH] CSRF protection implemented with per-request token rotation - Forms have csrfmiddlewaretoken. CSRF attacks blocked with 403 responses. SameSite=Lax on cookies may allow some cross-site requests.
[HIGH] User input in search field (unnamed search form) on main page - Query parameter (?q=) accepted. Should be tested for injection vulnerabilities including SSTI.
[MEDIUM] Security headers: X-Frame-Options DENY, X-Content-Type-Options nosniff, and SameSite=Lax implemented - Missing: HSTS, CSP, X-XSS-Protection. Moderate security posture.
[MEDIUM] Django version visible in error pages (ssti_debug_art_gallery.urls) - Allows version-specific exploit research. Framework and components identified.
[LOW] Static files serving from /static/ directory - Bootstrap, jQuery, and images accessible. Standard configuration. Verify directory listing is disabled.
[LOW] No admin panel exposed at /admin/ - Returns 404. Standard security by omission.
